header_summary: Tradeoff between trust and capital efficiency in the Lightning Network is discussed, highlighting the "thundering herd" problem and reduction in capital efficiency. Bitcoin Fusion Protocol (BFP) is introduced as a solution to theft concerns, offering advantages such as user custody and faster transfers. Issues with script output descriptors are addressed, proposing a new BIP proposal for standardization. Security measures in Hardware Security Module (HSM) and scaling Lightning channels for casual users are also discussed. Lastly, a draft bLIP maps the Taproot Asset Protocol onto the existing BOLT channel/invoice format.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the tradeoff between trust and capital efficiency in Lightning Network.
- It highlights the "thundering herd" problem that may occur if users need to recover their funds.
- The email suggests ways to optimize capital usage but warns of potential complexity.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Fusion Protocol (BFP)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the Bitcoin Fusion Protocol (BFP) addressing theft concerns and ownership by miners.
- The BFP introduces mechanisms like locking coins, conducting votes for approved blockchains, and light client verification.
- Advantages include user custody of coins, faster transfers, and the ability to send coins between sidechains.

recent_posts.title: New BIP to align descriptors, xpub derivation and miniscript
recent_posts.summary:
- Script output descriptors are gaining popularity in the programming community for creating wallet templates.
- There are redundancies and inconsistencies in the current implementation of descriptors.
- A new BIP44 purpose field is proposed to enforce standardized format and remove redundancies.

recent_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
recent_posts.summary:
- Christian and Bastien discuss implementing security measures in a Hardware Security Module (HSM).
- They consider choosing between Bolt 8 or rune management and experimenting with both.
- Access control and configuration on the lightning node side are important implementation details.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- The email proposes solutions to scale Lightning in a trust-free manner.
- Simple covenants can create Lightning channels for millions of casual users without complex coordination.
- Enabling timeout-trees allows accessible off-chain Bitcoin and rebalancing funds between Lightning channels.

recent_posts.title: blip-0029: Taproot Asset Protocol Channels
recent_posts.summary:
- A programmer has published a draft bLIP describing how to integrate the Taproot Asset Protocol into BOLT channel/invoice format.
- The bLIP introduces support for holding and transferring assets using the Taproot Assets Protocol.
- RFQ last-mile negotiation scheme and existing BOLT 11 invoice format enable multi-hop payments and asset acceptance.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains includes full 'blinding'.
- In blinded statechains, the server is trusted to report the number of partial signatures.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation for secure signature generation.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is sufficient due to several factors like pruning and affordable hardware.
- Assuming no pruning, growth would be 210.24GB per year, with the whole blockchain at 500GB.
- A 5TB hard drive for less than $150 provides 21 years of storage at a manageable cost.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes replacing multiple opcodes with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- The new opcode verifies P2TR scriptPubKeys and introduces additional parameters and flags.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests making lightning channels resumable with a new channel funding transaction.
- It introduces asymmetrical roles between Alice and Bob and includes fraud proofs for revoked states.
- The proposal also discusses saving bandwidth and concludes with remarks on alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard is proposing to organize the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- He acknowledges potential complexities and invites objections or feedback regarding his involvement.
- Antoine suggests surveying countries like Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria as potential hosts.

active_posts.title: Disclosure: Fake channel DoS vector
active_posts.summary:
- A DoS vector affects all node implementations, allowing an attacker to open fake channels.
- Recent releases of node software versions include defenses against the DoS vector.
- To protect your funds, update your node software to the specified versions.
